channel.title: Making a computer
channel.description:
Ok im 11 and im really good with computers :) but not like a tech guy.
so i want to buy a computer frame good ram and harddrives
so I'm going to ask YOU how i can make a good, fast computer by myself and it has to cost a little and it has to be good. :)
(also dont post comments about me being a little 11 year old :()

item.title: Making a computer
item.dc:creator: @I_own_mopar I_own_mopar
item.description:
@I_own_mopar wrote:

get this
ur friends will be fucking jelous cuz this is best and cheapest setup u can get, it owns nvidia and intel.

AMD Athlon 64 X2 6000+ Windsor 3.0GHz
ASUS M2A-MVP
HIS Hightech H165PRF512N-R Radeon X1650PRO 512MB x 2
CrossFire Bridge
SUPER TALENT 2GB x 2
Linkworld 630W
Liteon 20x DVDRW
SATA2 HD

  • any ATX case u want

then get all this into any store that sells pc components they will assemble it for you.

for 800$ u will have 3ghz 1000mhz dual core processor, 4GB 800mhz ram, 500GB SATA2 hard drive, 1GB video card…
beats anything u can find in store… and these are not cheap china parts that will fail in a year too.

but u can always go to best buy and buy a Gateway - Q6600 witch is 10 times slower for 1.799$[br][size=1]Posted on: August 16, 2007, 10:50:21 PM[/size][hr][quote=“exe626, post:3, topic:134353”]Pro Tips: If you don’t know how to make a computer, DON’T! You’ll probably end up wasting epic moneys and time.[/quote]

ur a fucking retard

Read full topic

item.title: Making a computer
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

A quick google search can lead you to some guides, such as http://www.shopsaskatchewan.com/Build-Computer-tutorial/

It really isn’t that hard to build a PC. But you should start off by upgrading your current one so that you can get to know the inside of a computer better.

I built my pc when my only knowledge was replacing the power supply, lol. It was a little over-whelming at first because I had no idea what I was doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a computer
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Runescape.com, post:5, topic:134353”]i been using computers since i was 9

and all that time i found out about diff viruses how to use mouses good explored computers[/quote]

But none of that has to do with actually building a computer. Someone might have driven a car for 40 years but might have no knowledge about how it actually works.

Like I said before, there’s probably some good reading material out there about how to build a decent machine. Just google search for ‘how to build a computer’.

Read full topic
